guideline.name: Annotation of CPIC Guideline for sertraline and CYP2B6, CYP2C19

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily B member 6
cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily C member 19

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300914

text.html:
Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose. Consider a slower titration schedule and lower maintenance dose than CYP2C19 normal metabolizers.

Other Considerations

CYP2B6 metabolizer status, drug-drug interactions and other patient characteristics (e.g., age, renal function, liver function) should be also considered.

implications: CYP2B6: n/a
CYP2C19: Reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300896

text.html: Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose.

implications: CYP2B6: Normal metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds.
CYP2C19: Small increase in metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300901

text.html: Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose.

implications: CYP2B6: Increase in metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers.
CYP2C19: Normal metabolism

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300927

text.html: Consider a lower starting dose, slower titration schedule and 50% reduction of standard maintenance dose as compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers or select a clinically appropriate alternative antidepressant not predominantly metabolized by CYP2C19.

implications: CYP2B6: n/a
CYP2C19: Greatly reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300892

text.html: No recommendation

implications: CYP2B6: n/a
CYP2C19: n/a

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300945

text.html:
Consider a lower starting dose, slower titration schedule and 25% reduction of standard maintenance dose as compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers or select a clinically appropriate alternative antidepressant not predominantly metabolized by CYP2B6.

Other Considerations

CYPC19 metabolizer status, drug-drug interactions and other patient characteristics (e.g., age, renal function, liver function) should be also considered.

implications: CYP2B6: Greatly reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.
CYP2C19: n/a

text.html: Consider a lower starting dose, slower titration schedule and 50% reduction of standard maintenance dose as compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers or select a clinically appropriate alternative antidepressant not predominantly metabolized by CYP2C19.

implications: CYP2B6: Reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers.
CYP2C19: Greatly reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

text.html: Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose.

implications: CYP2B6: Increase in metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers.

implications: CYP2B6: Small increase in metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers.
CYP2C19: Greatly reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

CYP2C19: Reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers.

text.html: Consider a lower starting dose, slower titration schedule and 25% reduction of standard maintenance dose as CYP2B6 normal metabolizers or select a clinically appropriate alternative antidepressant not predominantly metabolized by CYP2B6.

implications: CYP2B6: Greatly reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.

implications: CYP2B6: Normal metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds.

text.html: Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose. Consider a slower titration schedule and lower maintenance dose than normal metabolizers.

implications: CYP2B6: Reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers.
CYP2C19: Reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers.

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300905

text.html: Consider a lower starting dose, slower titration schedule and 25% reduction of standard maintenance dose as compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers or select a clinically appropriate alternative antidepressant not predominantly metabolized by CYP2B6.

implications: CYP2B6: Greatly reduced metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers. Higher plasma concentrations may increase the probability of side effects.
CYP2C19: Normal metabolism

recommendations.name: Recommendation PA166300887

text.html: Initiate therapy with recommended starting dose. If patient does not adequately respond to recommended maintenance dosing, consider titrating to a higher maintenance dose or switching to a clinically appropriate alternative antidepressant not predominantly metabolized by CYP2C19 or CYP2B6.

implications: CYP2B6: Increase in metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2B6 normal metabolizers.
CYP2C19: Small increase in metabolism of sertraline to less active compounds when compared to CYP2C19 normal metabolizers.

citations.title: Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) Guideline for CYP2D6, CYP2C19, CYP2B6, SLC6A4, and HTR2A Genotypes and Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitor Antidepressants.
